title: Preparation of fluorine-doped α-Ni hydroxides as alkaline water electrolysis catalysts via the liquid phase deposition method
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,4813-4819
DOI: 10.1039/D4SE00983E, Paper
Tomoyuki Watanabe, Kenko Tsuchimoto, Tomohiro Fukushima, Kei Murakoshi, Minoru Mizuhata, Hiro Minamimoto
A room-temperature liquid phase process was utilized to prepare α-Ni(OH)2 thin films with high crystallinity for use as oxygen evolution reaction catalysts under strongly alkaline conditions. It was observed that the incorporation of fluorine led to relatively higher catalytic activity.
